timeline.message:
test(engine): add inconsistency log test

 The test creates one log storage and two LogStreams, which use the same
 storage. On both streams events are written, which means events with
 same position end in the same log. The test verifies that
 starting a stream processor will mean that the StreamProcessor ends in
 fail mode.

timeline.bodyText: Nit: can we keep the same wording as we usually do for error messages?
timeline.author: npepinpe
npepinpe

timeline.bodyText: Since on recovery we switch the processor phase to Phase.PROCESSING, would comparing phases only not be enough? What additional guarantees does the latch provide?
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: It is more a remaining because I checked before whether I call this method. I kept that to verify that after we failed we haven't called it, but probably not necessary.
replies.author: Zelldon

timeline.bodyText:
Shouldn't it be:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                        new RecordStream(testStreams.events(getLogName(2)))
          
          
            
                        new RecordStream(testStreams.events(getLogName(1)))
timeline.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText: Is it enough to only test the first processor composite?
timeline.author: npepinpe

replies.bodyText: Don't we want to ensure that inconsistencies would be detected in both? I guess they're both too close to detect different cases that this test would fail. It's probably fine as is 👍
replies.author: npepinpe

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
              // things provisioned by this rule
timeline.author: npepinpe

timeline.message:
chore(engine): add inconsistence check

 On reprocessing we verify that the positions are increasing, if not we
 fail the stream processor.

 The test creates one log storage and two LogStreams, which use the same
 storage. On both streams events are written, which means events with
 same position end in the same log. The test verifies that
 starting a stream processor will mean that the StreamProcessor ends in
 fail mode.
